summary: Ocarina app with realistic and stylised views, now adding 15 preset songs with guided note sequences (step-by-step hole highlighting). Songs span classic folk, video game themes, and a mix of rock/electronic/reggae/reggaeton genres.
architectural_notes: Songs stored as note sequences with finger/hole coverage data; playback advances step-by-step with UI highlighting on the ocarina

existing_features.title: Define a library of 15 preset songs as structured note sequence data, organized into three categories: Classic Folk (Twinkle Twinkle Little Star, Happy Birthday, Mary Had a Little Lamb), Video Games (Zelda's Lullaby, Mario Underground Theme, Tetris Theme/Korobeiniki, Final Fantasy Prelude, Sweden from Minecraft, Megalovania from Undertale), and Mixed Genres (Smoke on the Water, Blue Da Ba Dee, Rivers of Babylon, Gasolina, Wonderwall, Around the World). Each song entry must include a title, category, tempo (BPM), and an ordered array of notes mapped to the existing Note type used in the composition system.

Add a Song Library UI panel or modal accessible from the main app layout that lists all 15 preset songs grouped by category (Classic Folk, Video Games, Mixed Genres). Users can browse and select a song to load it into a guided playback mode. Each song entry should show its title and category.

Implement a Guided Song Playback mode that, when a preset song is selected, displays the song's notes step-by-step. For each step: highlight the current note's fingering on the OcarinaIllustration (showing which holes to cover/uncover), show the note name, and advance through the sequence. Include playback controls (Play, Pause, Stop, Previous Step, Next Step) and display the current step number out of total steps (e.g., 'Step 3 of 24'). The mode should auto-advance through notes at the song's tempo when playing, or allow manual step-through when paused.

Add a visual step-by-step note guide alongside the ocarina illustration during guided playback, showing a scrollable or paginated list of upcoming notes with their fingering hole indicators. The current note should be prominently highlighted, and completed notes should be visually dimmed or marked. This gives the user an at-a-glance view of what notes are coming next in the sequence.

new_feature_requests.summary: Add 15 preset songs with guided note sequences (step-by-step hole highlighting and playback controls): 3 classic folk, 6 video game themes (Zelda, Mario, Tetris, Final Fantasy, Minecraft, Undertale), 6 mixed genres (rock, electronic, reggae, reggaeton)
